channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for WI
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for WI

item.title: Report E-2024010124
item.description:
Report E-2024010124

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-16T18:13:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-04
  • City: MILWAUKEE
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On January 4, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN2922 was damaged during transit and released approximately two and a half (2.5) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EnviroServe (ES) to remediate the impacted site. Crews deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and worked them in with hand tools. The damaged pail, all UN2922 impacted materials, and spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal purposes.

item.title: Report E-2024010133
item.description:
Report E-2024010133

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-16T18:13:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-08
  • City: TOMAH
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported a 15 gallon spill of UN3082 "Miramer M1142" that arrived damaged at Terminal XTM. (1) a 55-gallon metal drum was punctured by a nail in the pallet impacting Trailer. The SDS was reviewed with the terminal who felt comfortable completing the clean-up with terminal-issued PPE. (1) 95-gallon poly drum containing the impacted "Oil Dri" absorbent material, the damaged drum, the remaining material, and issued PPE was created as waste and left for the terminal to manage.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: 5 gallon steel drum of liquid taken off pickup van leaking along bottom rim DescribePack: Approximately 0.1 gallons leaked through bottom rim. Small dent visible along lower side but bottom rim not visibly displaced. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: placed in plastic tote under ventilator

item.title: Report X-2023120585
item.description:
Report X-2023120585

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-12T18:13:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-11
  • City: JANESVILLE
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNION PACIFIC RAILROAD COMPANY INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During inspection of tank car UTLX 641125 it was discovered that product was present on and adjacent of the manway nozzle. Visual damage was observed down both sides of the tank car assumed to be from poor loading or unloading procedures however It was determined that the observed wet product was a release due to over compression of the manway safety swing bolts by evidence of manway lid compressing on the nozzle frame.
